reviews.sentence: good stay but need improvements. My stay was nice however the curtain had a hole in it. The dresser was scratch up. Each time the next door room flush the toilet water leak in our bathroom. When we call it toke the repair man 3 hours to come and repair. The 35 streak restaurant closed at 10 pm which is sad seeing how they open in the even you would think the would be open later. The flat screen TV was out dated. It kept messing up. The first 2 night we only had 4 channels to watch. The strip is 10 minutes away if you are driving 30 minutes if you walk. Shuttle can only take 20 people at a time. You would think they would have 2 buses. The driver was really nice in coming back for the 2nd group versus making them wait a hour. Its cheaper to take a cab from and to the airport versus playing 8 each for the shuttle. Our room was not ready so we had to either take 2 queens size bed or a 1 king bed smoking. Photos need to be updated of rooms.

Dingy Digs. We checked into the hotel and immediately ended up in a room that was obviously a smokers previously. Very strong smoke smell. We called service and we were told they could move us the next morning and in the meantime they could bring us a humidifier. Unacceptable. We called again and we were able to switch rooms. The couch in the living area of the room was white in its hey day. However these days it was more of a mother of pearl. It looked sketchy dirty like maybe you should not lay too hard on it. The carpet needed to be replaced as it was dingy too. The room was not dirty it was just everything needed to be refreshed or replaced. Positive the beds were amazing and those sheets were crisp and fresh and the mattress was super comfy. The shower and bathroom were great and spa like. Guest services were great. Overall a decent experience. The music memorabilia helped take the edge off of the fact that the rooms were not 100 up to par.

Needs Work. For a premier property maintenance is sadly lacking. Room was tired looking for starters the shower curtain had seen its better days. No refrigerator or microwave in the room may I remind you that this is an amenity that even most Motel 6 now have. The ice machine that was closest to our room was broken. Really. You do not keep a spare to swap out when one goes down. If this was billed as an economy property I would say you get what you pay for but when you spend 200 bucks a night you expect everything to be clean maintained and in proper working order. How about the 50 a night deposit. What. I am over 50 stayed in a lot of hotels and never had someone charge me a deposit in case of damage. It gets better how about the 2495 per night Resort Fee that they do not tell you about until you check in. They do not include this so when you are booking online so it makes it look like they are a better value. This fee is supposed to cover the WiFi which never worked might I add. Ok now on to why I booked this hotel. It is pretty much a straight shot to the Convention Center which you could walk to if you felt so inclined. The restaurant Mr Luckys I think has a steak and shrimp special for 77 which is not on the menu so you will have to ask for it. The hotel does have miles of style in the lobby an public areas. And if you like rock memorabilia then you will be in hog heaven. They do have a great sound system have to say I have never heard better in a hotel.

Hard Rock renovations. Unfortunately I was not aware of the renovations happening at the casino when I made my reservations. The pit was closed off and you could hear equipment sanders hammers etc throughout the lobby. It was a dusty mess. Then the lobby was closed off and the registration desk was moved. Access to the outside was not easy and the taxi lines moved. I realize that when doing renovations there will be a certain amount of disruption but I definitely will not be staying there again until I know it is completed. I feel there should have been some way to inform potential patrons of the mess they were walking into so that the customer could choose another location if they did not want to deal. The people were very nice. The staff that I interacted with made the best of the situation. Reason this hotel was booked was due to the proximity of the Thomas Mack center Cox Pavilion. Easy access to the NBA Summer league games Let the customer know that construction is going on so they can decide if they want to book that location or not.

An OK hotel. I was told by peers to stay at this hotel thinking it would be great since it was all about hard rock music. I could have done without it. The carpet is dingey and very dark in places. We stayed in the Casino Tower and I believe it is the older rooms. The bathroom could be redone and new carpet in the corridors and hallways. Hardley anyone used the pool that I could see. It was not opened all the time. The balconies are not a balcony it has French doors that open and a bar that you can not even get a foot out. They are very strict on the Rehab area. My daughter and I just wanted to go to the Nirvana Pool and they carded us and searched us. The hotel restaurants are very good and the Casino was okay but I had seen better. Next time we will skip this hotel and do not expect to get any sleep a lot of banging on the simbles in hallways. The servers in the Casino were great and very friendly.

The first night was almost disappointing because after booking more than a month earlier the room that we were sent to had the bed upright a vacuum cleaner thrown down and work tool evident as if some sort of repair was taking place. We concluded that there was no available room when I arrived. The manager quickly corrected this by putting us up in a suite for the night. The rest of the week was okay. Nothing great to talk about.

Great hotel off the strip but has shuttles and you can cab anywhere for 10. The rooms were spacious and updated the housekeeping needs to do a better job for sure as there was dust and some sort of something on the ceiling. Other than that good atmosphere Pink Taco is great we even went to Heart and Huntington for piercings good time. PS this hotel has THE best beds ever.

classic casino room revamped. it is the hard rock what is not to like. Room was revamped but heater fan was broken closet door was missing bathroom scales did not work and I had to ask for a do not disturb sign.

Rooms are nice Casino tired. The property was built in 195. While the rooms have been recently refreshed I stayed in the Paradise Tower they really need to do something about the casino and commons areas. Good rock music throughout the venue was a bit too loud in Luckys for breakfast. Ate in Lucys good breakfast eats Pink Taco great eats and tequila selection 35 Martinis had brunch there was not impressed with the decor. I too would suggest one an upper floor for your stay. I am not a smoker but tolerant. The stale smoke in the casino and common areas was a bit overwhelming. With the smoke removal equipment available there is no reason so have such a high level of stale smoke. unles that is part of the rocker club experience they are going for.

wo nt stay here again. Went on a get away weekend for my birthday and when i checked in the receptionist said that she will give us a newly updated room to find out we were facing another building. Not a pretty sight when i reserved the room the description of the room was mountain view Not happy about that. Day 2cleaning lady did not give us any towels or toilet paper had to find a lady across the hall to request these items. Day 3 we had the do not disturb sign up and around 11 am the bell boy knocks on the door and asked if we checked out yet we still had until the next day to do this. Apparently he was in the wrong room. Day 4 had the do not disturb sign up again and at 9 am cleaning lady knocks on the door. Uhm i thought check out was 11. Not to mention the room next door must have had about 5 6 people in there that were loud all night and had us up by 6 am. This hotel was too far to walk from the strip we had a rental but did nt even use it because the majority of the hotels charged for parking. We ended up taking a cab to the strip that cost us about 17 one way because the hotel failed to let us know that they offered a shuttle to the hotel. Last but not least the daily room fee. the hotel flailed to let us know about this until we noticed the fees upon check out.

Treated like royalty at the Hard Rock. The rooms were average Vegas Nice Clean could use a little updating A few modern charging stations would be nice but the employees make a resort. We checked in ver late because of flight delays of course being responsible we called ahead twice to make sure they did not give up our room. When we arrived We did not get our pool view room as we paid for but we were upgraded to the all suite tower and they did waive our report fees and comp us a few bucks for dinner. Very fair in my opinion and they were very gracious and kind about it all. The customer service from all aspects of this hotel was top notch. I would stay here again in a minute.
Did nt get what was pitched to me by sales and place needed alot of regular maintenance. There are better places to stay for the price.
First time seeing the renovated casino. I love the new circle bar and appreciated the talented Acrobats around the floor.

Rip off. I booked 2 full beds thru Orbitz but the front desk saidI could only have it if I paid 20 more. Supposedly this was for the upgraded casino tower. Well it was worn out and needed a refurb. Definitely a shady resort. I will never return to another Hard Rock establishment.

Overall an OK place to stay for business purposes without breaking the bank. The hotel was located off the strip so not a lot of traffic which was nice when having to drive to meetings. The hotel also had a smaller casino which cut back on the people traffic and was easy to play at a table whenever I wanted without having to wait. The bartenders were also very impressive I tried some drinks that I have never had before and they could make any drink I or my partners asked for which was nice. The shower in my accommodation was broken and took the hotel two days to fix it after reporting it. I was not able to move rooms as the only rooms open were above an beyond apparently. Also my personal room safe was broken and beyond repair as the desk told me so thank goodness I had a computer lock and Ipad lock with me to secure these items while I was out and about. I was not compensated for any of the problems which was poor on the staffs part and I should not have even needed to ask if that was an option. If I was rating the hotel on the room alone I would have given them a 1 for poor maintenance of their rooms. The desk and management staff could have been more accommodating and easier to work through the issues I raised about the facilities. I did use the business center as well and ship two large packages to the hotel that could not travel with me on the plane. The business center charges an additional 45 per package just so you can receive it even though you paid the shipping charges with the mail carrier. I have never heard of this at any other hotel or resort I have stayed at while travelling for work.
This place need some Reno soon.

overall a good deal but some room for improvement. overall this is good deal. parking and wifi are both complimentary. Hotel is old. But it looks that recent renovation has been done. lack of some details. no coffee maker. The front desk never answers the phone. Delivery of hot water costs almost 7.

Mediocore. Husband and I stayed here during our first visit to Vegas. Hotel was nice but the rooms are dated and can use a facelift we stayed in the casino towerWe would n’t stay here again as the location is a little off the strip and there was no real wow factor for us to come back.

This hotel is suited more for the younger hip and trendy crowd. No refer or microwave in rooms. There are pool parties from around 10 am to 6 pm and the bass will rattle your windows the whole time if your room is on the pool side so i would ask for a room away from the pools if your looking for quiet. Not many food choices here either and definitely not much Vegan available. Walking to the strip is possible but is not intirerly on sidewalks and can be a little dangerous in some spots especially if your walking with little children. So stick to Lyft or Uber for the 2 mile trek to the strip. Here for a business trip for my wife not for leisure so we are not doing any shows or gambling. Will update if anything of merit changes during our stay.
The renovated old tower is nice. The hallways and pool side can be loud at times but hey it is Vegas. it is sad it will no longer be Hard Rock next year. I hope the new spot will be as unique.

If I could give less than one star I would. The Paradise tower needs to be shut down and remodeled. It is OLD and outdated. it is like stepping back into the 70s coming into these rooms. The rooms are small and the bathroom is even smaller. The showerhead sprays water all over tbe bathroom. The floor is dirty. The decor ia dark. There is a bar sticking out from under one of the beds. I am overly disapinted and will not be back.
Good updates on the rooms. Clean and good service.
Beautiful I just felt like it had more to offer but a lot of the areas were under renovation.

Room had no bathroom fan coffee maker microwave or mini fridge. BUT we got a great deal through Hotel Tonight and they had free Wi Fi and parking included. Staff was friendly and the Nirvana pool 1 of 4 was absolutely amazing. Bed was super comfortable and the memorabilia throughout the hotel and casino was very cool. The wait for coffee at Duncan Donuts was about a half hour at 9 AM on a Saturday morning that was annoying but all in all we had a great stay. Renovations make this a really nice stay right off the strip. Would stay again highly recommended.
Virgin just bought it and will start renovations. Still one of our favorite places to stay.

Such a great vacation experience. Great location with a car rental to get to strip however the free shuttle from hotel is a great amenity too. Room décor has a masculine feel in Paradise Tower however the restaurants on site are ALL delicious. I enjoyed the spa facial I received as well and the juice bar nearby. The pools are great with a tropic vibe with the palm trees. I know this is the last horah for Hard Rock before it gets remodeled into Virgin Hotel. I am glad we got to experience the luxury.
Always love it there can not wait for the new renovations to be done.

Exceptional. Great value for money. Clean updated very good amenities friendly staff. A bit further from the strip than expected. I had say it was a 20mins walking or more. The strip looks deceptively close due to the large buildings.
I love how they remodeled the whole hotel.
